texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: 🤔  This is another post in a set of posts on  options trading . If you are new to options trading, you may want to start with some of my earlier posts.
texts.text: 🤔  This is another post in a set of posts on  options trading . If you are new to options trading, you may want to start with some of my earlier posts.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: After writing my original blog post about  selling options contracts in the stock market , I received some feedback saying that the post jumped over too many steps and used too much terminology. I went back, re-read the post, and found lots of room for improvement.
texts.text: After writing my original blog post about  selling options contracts in the stock market , I received some feedback saying that the post jumped over too many steps and used too much terminology. I went back, re-read the post, and found lots of room for improvement.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If you understood the original post, then this post probably won't give you much additional insight. However, if the original post left you perplexed, I hope this post helps.
texts.text: If you understood the original post, then this post probably won't give you much additional insight. However, if the original post left you perplexed, I hope this post helps.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Starting out with an asset
texts.text: Starting out with an asset

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Let's say you love classic cars. Many older cars that are one of a kind or very well maintained can keep their value for a long time. Sometimes they even go up in value over time due to demand!
texts.text: Let's say you love classic cars. Many older cars that are one of a kind or very well maintained can keep their value for a long time. Sometimes they even go up in value over time due to demand!

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You find a great deal on a gorgeous car for $15,000. It's perfect! Also, demand has gone up for the car recently because it was featured in a popular movie, so it might be worth more after a while.
texts.text: You find a great deal on a gorgeous car for $15,000. It's perfect! Also, demand has gone up for the car recently because it was featured in a popular movie, so it might be worth more after a while.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: So you invested $15,000 in the car. But wait, what if the car is stolen or involved in a collision. Would it be worth $15,000 then? Likely not. Let's assume that the car would lose half its value if it was involved in a collision.
texts.text: So you invested $15,000 in the car. But wait, what if the car is stolen or involved in a collision. Would it be worth $15,000 then? Likely not. Let's assume that the car would lose half its value if it was involved in a collision.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: How do you protect it? Insurance.
texts.text: How do you protect it? Insurance.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You call your insurance company and ask how much it costs for a six month auto policy on the car valued at $15,000. They offer you a deal of $500 for six months. You give them $500 and they insure your car.
texts.text: You call your insurance company and ask how much it costs for a six month auto policy on the car valued at $15,000. They offer you a deal of $500 for six months. You give them $500 and they insure your car.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Let's convert this to options terminology:
texts.text: Let's convert this to options terminology:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: You bought the car (which is like buying stock).
texts.text: You bought the car (which is like buying stock).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: You're worried about the value of the car going down, so you bought
texts.text: You're worried about the value of the car going down, so you bought

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The insurance company sold you the policy (like selling a put).
texts.text: The insurance company sold you the policy (like selling a put).

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The movie is a hit!
texts.text: The movie is a hit!

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The movie that featured the same kind of car as yours was a huge success and now the demand for your classic car is way up. You can easily sell the car for $30,000 now!
texts.text: The movie that featured the same kind of car as yours was a huge success and now the demand for your classic car is way up. You can easily sell the car for $30,000 now!

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: But what about that insurance policy when the car was worth $15,000? It's worth less now because the value of the car has increased so much. If you got in a wreck now and the price of the car was cut in half to $15,000, your insurance policy would still be there, but the value of the car is insured at $15,000.
texts.text: But what about that insurance policy when the car was worth $15,000? It's worth less now because the value of the car has increased so much. If you got in a wreck now and the price of the car was cut in half to $15,000, your insurance policy would still be there, but the value of the car is insured at $15,000.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: So you call your insurance company and ask for a new policy. They agree to make a new policy for six months for $1,250. But wait, the car doubled in value and the insurance policy went up by 2.5x. Why is that?
texts.text: So you call your insurance company and ask for a new policy. They agree to make a new policy for six months for $1,250. But wait, the car doubled in value and the insurance policy went up by 2.5x. Why is that?

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The increase in price of the insurance policy is due to the value going up, but now the value is volatile. It's more difficult for the insurance company to gauge the value of the car, how much the parts cost, and how much the labor would be to fix it.
texts.text: The increase in price of the insurance policy is due to the value going up, but now the value is volatile. It's more difficult for the insurance company to gauge the value of the car, how much the parts cost, and how much the labor would be to fix it.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You decide to sell your original $500 policy and buy the new one for $1,250 that protects your car valued at $30,000.
texts.text: You decide to sell your original $500 policy and buy the new one for $1,250 that protects your car valued at $30,000.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Back to options terminology:
texts.text: Back to options terminology:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The value of the car (stock) went up.
texts.text: The value of the car (stock) went up.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: When you needed insurance for the higher value (a put with a higher strike
texts.text: When you needed insurance for the higher value (a put with a higher strike

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The insurance company bought back your old insurance plan (like buying a
texts.text: The insurance company bought back your old insurance plan (like buying a

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: You bought the new insurance plan (like buying a new put).
texts.text: You bought the new insurance plan (like buying a new put).

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Too fast, too furious
texts.text: Too fast, too furious

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You're on the freeway in your classic car and you weren't paying attention to the speed limit. A police officer saw you, pulled you over, and issued you a big ticket which included reckless driving.
texts.text: You're on the freeway in your classic car and you weren't paying attention to the speed limit. A police officer saw you, pulled you over, and issued you a big ticket which included reckless driving.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: It's time to renew your insurance policy again. But now, the insurance company wants $1,500 to insure your $30,000 car. Why are you paying more for the same amount of insurance coverage?
texts.text: It's time to renew your insurance policy again. But now, the insurance company wants $1,500 to insure your $30,000 car. Why are you paying more for the same amount of insurance coverage?

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The insurance company was notified about your massive speeding ticket and they believe that increased the chances of your car being involved in an accident. They want more money from you because there's a higher chance of the value of your car going down drastically (due to an collision).
texts.text: The insurance company was notified about your massive speeding ticket and they believe that increased the chances of your car being involved in an accident. They want more money from you because there's a higher chance of the value of your car going down drastically (due to an collision).

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: This happens with options trades, too. When there's a bigger chance of a swing in the price of a stock, the implied volatility goes up. That means it's more expensive to buy options and that selling options pays out more premium (just like the car insurance company could charge extra). The insurance seller (put seller) is taking more risk by selling insurance (puts) and demands to be paid more for it.
texts.text: This happens with options trades, too. When there's a bigger chance of a swing in the price of a stock, the implied volatility goes up. That means it's more expensive to buy options and that selling options pays out more premium (just like the car insurance company could charge extra). The insurance seller (put seller) is taking more risk by selling insurance (puts) and demands to be paid more for it.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: It wasn't my fault!
texts.text: It wasn't my fault!

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You learned from your speeding ticket, which is good, but you ran a red light in town and collided with another car! Luckily everyone was okay, but your car is in terrible shape. It will need a lot of repairs.
texts.text: You learned from your speeding ticket, which is good, but you ran a red light in town and collided with another car! Luckily everyone was okay, but your car is in terrible shape. It will need a lot of repairs.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You call your insurance company to tell them about it and they send you to a repair shop. The estimate to repair the car is $10,000. The insurance company pays for the repairs, but they have lost money on your policy ($1,500 premium minus $10k in repairs).
texts.text: You call your insurance company to tell them about it and they send you to a repair shop. The estimate to repair the car is $10,000. The insurance company pays for the repairs, but they have lost money on your policy ($1,500 premium minus $10k in repairs).

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Once the repairs are finished, your insurance company says if you want to get insured again, it's going to be $3,000 for six months. Again, volatility is in play here. Your car went from $15k to $30k to $20k in the eyes of the insurance company and that's plenty of volatility.
texts.text: Once the repairs are finished, your insurance company says if you want to get insured again, it's going to be $3,000 for six months. Again, volatility is in play here. Your car went from $15k to $30k to $20k in the eyes of the insurance company and that's plenty of volatility.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Conclusion
texts.text: Conclusion

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Selling puts in the stock market allows you to act like an insurance agent for traders and institutions that want to buy insurance for their stock. If you choose high-quality companies that have good fundamentals and desirable products, then the chances of that insurance getting a claim is relatively low.
texts.text: Selling puts in the stock market allows you to act like an insurance agent for traders and institutions that want to buy insurance for their stock. If you choose high-quality companies that have good fundamentals and desirable products, then the chances of that insurance getting a claim is relatively low.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Very risky stocks, including those that have not been trading long (think IPOs) and those that have wild swings in value, pay out much more premium for this insurance, but as a put seller, you are on the hook for that swing in valuation.
texts.text: Very risky stocks, including those that have not been trading long (think IPOs) and those that have wild swings in value, pay out much more premium for this insurance, but as a put seller, you are on the hook for that swing in valuation.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Striking the right balance between the amount of premium received and the amount of risk taken is a difficult one. Companies that have been around for a hundred years with steady growth are not likely going down any time soon, but there's not much premium for puts there. On the other hand, brand new companies could swing up and down drastically and the premium is high for those stocks.
texts.text: Striking the right balance between the amount of premium received and the amount of risk taken is a difficult one. Companies that have been around for a hundred years with steady growth are not likely going down any time soon, but there's not much premium for puts there. On the other hand, brand new companies could swing up and down drastically and the premium is high for those stocks.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Disclaimer: Keep in mind that I am not an investment professional and you should make your own decisions around stock research and trades. Investing comes with plenty of risk and I'm the last person who should be giving anyone investment advice.  😜
texts.text: Disclaimer: Keep in mind that I am not an investment professional and you should make your own decisions around stock research and trades. Investing comes with plenty of risk and I'm the last person who should be giving anyone investment advice.  😜
